post_info.post_title: Black holes and speed of light.

gravity bends space, which is why it has an effect on light. The problem you have is that you're trying to apply Newtonian laws of motion to relativistic situations. Matter that passes the event horizon of a black hole is NOT travelling at the speed of light, and the nature of the relativistic equations is that it takes more and more force to accelerate a body the closer is gets to the speed of light, and in fact no body with mass can ever reach that speed. Hope that helps.
